article.title: Raytheon to Develop Radar Software for Seven Countries
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Raytheon Company, Goleta, California, is being awarded a $48,663,690 cost-plus-fixed-fee, indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract for software development support of the ALR-67(V) 3 radar for the U.S. Navy and the governments of Australia, Kuwait, Qatar, Malaysia, Switzerland, Canada, and various other future foreign military sales customers.Â The Naval Air Systems Command, Weapons Division, China Lake, California, is the contracting activity.
